info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 7:39AM CDT until August 08 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL DE KALB, NORTHERN LEE AND SOUTHERN OGLE COUNTIES... At 739 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rainfall covering Ogle County and portions of central DeKalb County. The heaviest rainfall is expected to remain near the Polo to Oregon to Rochelle to DeKalb area over the next 30 minutes. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are likely with these storms. Additional rainfall amounts up to 3 inches are possible on top of the 1 to 2 inches which have already occurred. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... DeKalb, Sycamore, Rochelle, Oregon, Polo, Cortland, Hinckley, Hillcrest, Maple Park, Malta, Ashton, Lost Nation, Creston, Grand Detour, Lee, Steward, Kings, Chana and Woosung. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
